00046 /**
00047  * @brief Default Getter method for parameters and their documentation.

00050 std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> CNAnalysisMethodGaussianSmooth::
00051 getDefaultDocOptions()
00052 {

00054 
00055   // SelfDoc::Opt(name, type, value, default, min, max, description)
00056

00058         "1", "1", "NA", "NA", "Exp Smooth Signal"};
00059   opts.push_back(expSmoothSignal);
00060 
00061   SelfDoc::Opt smooth_sigma_multiplier = {"smooth_sigma_multiplier",
00062         SelfDoc::Opt::Double, "2", "2", "0.0", "NA", "Smooth Sigma Multiplier"};
00063   opts.push_back(smooth_sigma_multiplier);
00064 
00065   SelfDoc::Opt smooth_window = {"smooth_bw", SelfDoc::Opt::Integer,
00066         "50000", "50000", "1", "NA", "Smooth Gaussian BW"};
00067   opts.push_back(smooth_window);
00068 
00069   return opts;

00072 /**
00073  * @brief This static function should be overridden by child classes
00074  * to return an object of the correct type initialized correctly
00075  * with the parameters in the string, string map. All objects
00076  * created this way should be deleted when finished using.
00077  *
00078  * @param param - Map of key/value pairs to initialize the object.
00079  *
00080  * @return Pointer toCreate object, this should be sub casted as necessary.
00081  */
00082 SelfCreate * CNAnalysisMethodGaussianSmooth::
00083 newObject(std::map<std::string,std::string> & params)
00084     {
00085     SelfDoc doc = explainSelf();
00086     std::vector<SelfDoc::Opt> opts = getDefaultDocOptions();
00087 
00088     CNAnalysisMethodGaussianSmooth * pMethod;
00089     pMethod = new CNAnalysisMethodGaussianSmooth();
00090 
00091     std::string strPrefix = getPrefix();
00092 
00093     pMethod->m_iExpSmoothSignal = setupIntParameter("expSmoothSignal",
00094         strPrefix, params, doc, opts);
00095 
00096     pMethod->m_fSmoothSigmaMultiplier = setupFloatParameter(
00097         "smooth_sigma_multiplier", strPrefix, params, doc, opts);
00098 
00099     pMethod->m_smooth_bw = setupIntParameter("smooth_bw",
00100         strPrefix, params, doc, opts);
00101 
00102     return pMethod;
00103     }

00105 /**
00106  * @brief Run the analysis
00107  */
00108 void CNAnalysisMethodGaussianSmooth::run()
00109     {
00110     Verbose::out(1, "CNAnalysisMethodGaussianSmooth::run(...) start");
00111     isSetup();
00112     m_pEngine->setOpt("gaussian-smooth-exp", ::getInt(m_iExpSmoothSignal));
00113 
00114     int last_chr = getProbeSets()->at(getProbeSets()->size() - 1)->getChromosome();
00115 
00116 //    Verbose::progressBegin(1, "CNAnalysisMethodGaussianSmooth::run(...) ",
00117 //        last_chr, 1, last_chr);
00118 
00119     for (int chr=1; (chr<=last_chr); chr++)
00120         {
00121         int iProbeSetCount = getProbeSetCount(chr, getProbeSets());
00122         if (iProbeSetCount == 0) continue;
00123 //        Verbose::progressStep(1);
00124         try
00125             {
00126             std::vector<int> vPositions(iProbeSetCount);
00127             std::vector<float> vLog2Ratios(iProbeSetCount);
00128             int iIndex = 0;
00129             for (int i=0; i<getProbeSets()->size(); i++)
00130                 {
00131                 CNProbeSet* pobjProbeSet = getProbeSets()->at(i);
00132                 if (pobjProbeSet->getChromosome() == chr)
00133                     {
00134                     vPositions[iIndex] = pobjProbeSet->getPosition();
00135                     vLog2Ratios[iIndex] = pobjProbeSet->getLog2Ratio();
00136                     iIndex++;
00137                     }
00138                 }
00139 
00140             if (m_iExpSmoothSignal >= 0)
00141                 {
00142                 calculateGaussianSmooth(chr, vPositions, vLog2Ratios);
00143                 }
00144             }
00145 
00146         catch(...)
00147             {
00148             Verbose::out(1, "CNAnalysisMethodGaussianSmooth::run(...) Working on Chromosome " + ::getInt(chr));
00149             throw;
00150             }
00151 
00152         }
00153     normalizeGaussianSmooth();
00154 //    Verbose::progressEnd(1, "Done");
00155     Verbose::out(1, "CNAnalysisMethodGaussianSmooth::run(...) end");
00156     }
00157 
00158 /**
00159  * @brief Smooth the log2 ratios
00160  * @param int - Chromosome to process
00161  * @param bool - Is this an chromosome an autosome
00162  * @param std::vector<int>& - The vector of chromosome positions
00163  * @param std::vector<float>& - The vector of log2 ratios to smooth
00164  */
00165 void CNAnalysisMethodGaussianSmooth::calculateGaussianSmooth(
00166         int iChromosome,
00167         std::vector<int>& vPositions,
00168         std::vector<float>& vLog2Ratios)
00169     {
00170     try
00171         {
00172         smooth(vLog2Ratios, vPositions, m_smooth_bw,
00173                 m_fSmoothSigmaMultiplier, 0, (int)vLog2Ratios.size());
00174         }
00175 
00176     catch (Except e) { throw; }
00177     int iIndex = 0;
00178 
00179     for (int i=0; i<getProbeSets()->size(); i++)
00180         {
00181         CNProbeSet* pobjProbeSet = getProbeSets()->at(i);
00182         if (pobjProbeSet->getChromosome() == iChromosome)
00183             {
00184             pobjProbeSet->setSmoothedLog2Ratio(vLog2Ratios[iIndex]);
00185             iIndex++;
00186             }
00187         }
00188     }
00189 
00190 /**
00191  * @brief Given a list of log2 ratios and the corresponding positions on
00192  * a given chromosome this method will do gaussian smoothing on the
00193  * data.  This will smooth all positions with the unsmoothed data to
00194  * avoid biasing the smoothing process.  It would be biased because
00195  * the left side would be smoothed and the right side wouldn't be.
00196  *
00197  * @param lrvals   - Log2 ratios to smooth for a given sample on a given
00198  * chromosome
00199  * @param position - The SNP positions corresponding to the log2 ratios ("lrvals").
00200  * @param bw       - The bandwidth to use for the smoothing process.
00201  * @param startidx - The start position in the position vector.
00202  * @param sz       - The number of positions that should be processed.
00203  */
00204 void CNAnalysisMethodGaussianSmooth::smooth( std::vector<float>& lrvals, const std::vector<int>& position,
00205                                              int smooth_bw,
00206                                              float sigmaMultiplier, int startidx, int sz)
00207 {
00208   if ( !(lrvals.size()==position.size()) || !(smooth_bw > 0) || !(sz<=(int)lrvals.size())
00209     || !(startidx<sz) ) {
00210     GSERR_CHECK(lrvals.size()==position.size(), "Mismatch between the number of log2 ratios and the number of positions: #log2 ratios = " + ToStr(lrvals.size()) + "  # positions = " + ToStr(position.size()));
00211     GSERR_CHECK(smooth_bw>0, "The gaussian-smooth parameter  smooth_bw must be > 0");
00212     GSERR_CHECK(sz<=(int)lrvals.size(),"end index past end of array  end = "
00213                + ToStr(sz-1) + "  array length = " + ToStr(lrvals.size()));
00214     GSERR_CHECK(startidx<(int)sz, "start index " + ToStr(startidx)
00215               + " is larger than the end index " + ToStr(sz-1));
00216   }
00217 
00218   // Need more than 1 SNP to do smoothing
00219   if (lrvals.size() == 1) return;
00220 
00221   float smoothDist = smooth_bw * sigmaMultiplier;
00222   // The original log2 ratios must be kept track of since they are needed
00223   // for smoothing.  The smoothed log2 ratios will be kept in "tmplr"
00224   // until smoothing is done, then they will be copied to "lrvals".
00225   float* tmplr = new float[sz];         // Holds the smoothed log2 ratios.
00226   int iIndex = 0;
00227   int     lbidx     = 0; // Lower bound
00228   int     ubidx     = 0; // Upper bound
00229   int     curridx   = 0; // Index of current SNP being Smoothed.
00230   long    dist      = 0; // Distance between SNPs.
00231   double numerator = 0.0, denominator = 0.0;
00232   int idx = 0;
00233   for (curridx = startidx; curridx < sz; ++curridx) {
00234     // Compute lower bandwidth index
00235     while ( (dist = position[curridx] - position[lbidx]) > smoothDist ) {
00236       ++lbidx;
00237     }
00238     // Compute upper bandwidth index
00239     ubidx = curridx + 1; // Set to the position after the current pos.
00240     while (    ubidx < sz
00241            && (dist = position[ubidx] - position[curridx]) <= smoothDist) {
00242       ++ubidx;
00243     }
00244     /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00245     // Do smoothing starting from the "lbidx" to the "ubidx".
00246     /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00247     // Compute numerator and denominator.
00248     numerator   = 0.0;
00249     denominator = 0.0;
00250     // Loop from the lower bound ("lbidx") to the upper bound ("ubidx")
00251     // updating the numerator and denominator.
00252     for (idx = lbidx; idx < ubidx; ++idx) {
00253       double posdiff = position[idx]-position[curridx];
00254       double t       = posdiff/smooth_bw;
00255       double expon   = exp(-0.5*(t*t));
00256       numerator   += lrvals[idx] * expon;
00257       denominator += expon;
00258     }
00259     tmplr[iIndex] = (float)(numerator/denominator);
00260     iIndex++;
00261   }
00262   // Copy smoothed values to original log2 ratio vector.
00263   for (int idx = 0; idx < iIndex; ++idx) {
00264     lrvals[idx+startidx] = tmplr[idx];
00265   }
00266   delete[] tmplr;
00267 } // smooth(...)

00272  * @brief Normalize the smoothed values
00273  */
00274 void CNAnalysisMethodGaussianSmooth::normalizeGaussianSmooth()
00275     {
00276         // This is now being done ni the cnreporter classes.
00277     if (m_iExpSmoothSignal != 1) return;
00278     /*
00279     double scale = 1.0/m_pEngine->getOptDouble("alpha-cn-calibrate");
00280     double shift = m_pEngine->getOptDouble("beta-cn-calibrate");
00281 
00282     for (int i=0; i<getProbeSets()->size(); i++)
00283         {
00284         CNProbeSet * pobjProbeSet = getProbeSets()->at(i);
00285         double log_intensity = pobjProbeSet->getSmoothedLog2Ratio();
00286         log_intensity *= scale;
00287         log_intensity += shift;
00288 
00289         pobjProbeSet->setSmoothedLog2Ratio((float)exp(log_intensity*log(2.0)));
00290         }
00291         */
00292     }
